channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Ambo damage to agriculture hits P1 billion
item.author: Louise Maureen Simeon
item.description: Damage to the agriculture sector in areas battered by Typhoon Ambo has climbed to P1.04 billion, the Department of Agriculture-Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Operations Center reported yesterday.

item.title: House plenary recalls ABS-CBN franchise OK
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: To pave the way for possible amendments, the leadership of the House of Representatives recalled yesterday the approval it gave on second reading to the bill granting ABS-CBN a provisional franchise.

item.title: Expect more thunderstorms – PAGASA
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Filipinos should brace for frequent thunderstorms in the coming days, the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration said yesterday.

item.title: Next cash aid to benefit 20.3 million Households
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: More than 20 million individuals are expected to benefit from the second tranche of the government’s aid programs for sectors sidelined by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Gasoline prices up P1.25; diesel higher by 55¢
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: Oil companies are raising pump prices anew this week amid higher global prices as businesses reopen.

item.title: ‘Escaped’OFW found, tests positive for COVID
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: An overseas Filipino worker, who escaped from a quarantine facility and was later found positive for coronavirus disease 2019, has been found and brought to a medical treatment facility.

item.title: Palace sees spike in COVID-19 cases
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang is expecting a spike in coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 cases because of the failure of some people to observe physical distancing in malls over the weekend.

item.title: Help stranded Pinoys — Go
item.description: As the initial phase of the Balik Probinsya, Bagong Pag-asa Program begins, Sen. Bong Go has reminded the government to immediately help individuals and families stranded in Metro Manila and other urban centers amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Passengers should provide contact details to drivers, conductors
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: Public utility vehicle drivers and conductors will be required to keep a record of their passengers for contact tracing when mass transport operations resume under the general community quarantine, the Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board said yesterday.

item.title: Palace to bishops: Present plan on distancing
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang yesterday urged Catholic bishops to present to the government their plan on implementing safe physical distancing during masses.
